It's best to play this first then Portal 2. It's short, but man Valve was just ahead of the curve at its time. Even with the knowledge of Portal 2 and the lore, it felt like an entirely different experience even though I was zooming through all the levels. It's a really great game and I'm sad that I missed out on all of the fun.
Interesting story and excellent mechanics, the main story is fairly short but the replayability is incredible with the bonus maps.

One of the best games ever, looks simple enough but is a masterpiece. Awesome concept (portals), cool environment, many interesting puzzles, great humor,  fluid game-play.  Majority of puzzles are not very difficult, yet, after solving most of them, there is 'that was very cool/clever' moment.  In addition to all those chambers it actually has a story. Recommended for everyone.

I just picked up this game, remembering when I was just 8 years old and my mom picked up portal 2 for me because it looked like a neat game for kids. I don't remember ever finishing Portal 2 but after seeing Portal on the Valve Bundle I decided to play it and boy did it bring me back to my childhood. The music is amazing in this game and the overarching eerie atmosphere just makes the game so interesting. 10/10 about to play Portal 2

A fun game for people who like solving puzzles with great use of the physics engine. However it is really short and I have seen people get motion sickness from some puzzles. The story of the testing facility is told to you in a very subtle way like the Half Life games, and indeed that is no coincidense. I have played it about 5 times through on PC and PS3, never getting bored, but fondly remembering how much more mentally challenged I was the first time around

An absolutely fantastic, unique and memorable puzzle game that will have you laughing out loud to the one way conversations that GLaDOS, excellently voiced by Ellen McLain, will try to have with you. Whilst the main story is quite short and didn’t have me scratching my head, the optional bonus maps will prove to be more of a challenge for most. Collectables found throughout the campaign provide replay value. However, there isn’t much motivation other than two achievements to actually try to find all collectables.

SOME SPOILERS MAY NOT BE PROPERLY MARKED. YOU HAVE BEEN WARNED.

"Portal" is an excellently done first-person game, following a character through many scientific tests. This is the first of two, and I would recommend playing this one first if you are interested in the sequel.

[b]STORY LINE:[/b] There isn't much of a story-line, but it starts picking up near the end.

[b]GAME PLAY:[/b] Puzzles that slowly get harder as you get further into the game. Requires brain power. Usage of a portal device--surprise! Shocking for a game named [b]"PORTAL"[/b].

...Apologies for my sarcasm, it's just... are you surprised? With a name like "Portal"?

[b]GAME CONTROLS:[/b] It is [i]highly recommended[/i] that if you are using a laptop or any computer with a touchpad that you use a mouse. Otherwise, your gaming experience will be very, very difficult. Arrow-keys are used for moving your character around. Spacebar to jump. Mouse used to look around and shoot portals. Other buttons are explained in game.

[b]CHARACTERS:[/b] You play as a mute character. They do not speak. Meanwhile, you are accompanied by an pre-programmed AI through the facility as you complete tests. [spoiler]Except, they aren't pre-programmed. Oh, and also? They want to kill you. Interesting facts, y'know?[/spoiler]

[b]CAUTION:[/b] Please keep in mind that looking at these spoilers may change or ruin your experience, as they are not necessary for enjoyment of the game. They are only if you get disturbed easily by a lack of nothing, loud noises, or sudden events. The minimal usage of music (which is also electric sounding) may be unnerving to some. If you [spoiler]die[/spoiler], you may be kind of freaked out. Also, [spoiler] it may be startling to encounter turrets, which will shoot at you[/spoiler]. Finally, (MAJOR SPOILER) [spoiler]it may be incredibly shocking when you start heading into a fiery pit. Yep, that friendly AI is trying to kill you[/spoiler].

"Portal" is a fantastic game, and while it may be less entertaining than the second game, "Portal 2", I would highly recommend playing it. It has kept me busy for hours, and figuring out the puzzles can be very pleasing. There is also an Easter Egg, for those who enjoy that sort of thing.

This is probably one of the best games I have ever played. There's so much to be done in this game despite the short story of the first game. Following it are challenge missions, which are very fun. The second game I bought with the first but have not played it yet, but I heard the story ties well, and that the CO-OP with other players is very fun. This game gets a 15/10, it's that good. I love the sarcasm and irony, it gives life to the gloomy setting of the levels and such (which is not a problem in general). Really well woven game, and I've never played anything like it. Totally recommend.
